thread.title: International Drone Photography Contest best photos | Travel | Travel Holiday Deals
thread.title_full: International Drone Photography Contest best photos | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals | | The Advertiser

author: Shoba Rao and Jack Williams
title: International Drone Photography Contest best photos | Travel | Travel Holiday Deals
text:
DRONE-ADDICTED photographers have taken some of the most amazing images for this year’s International Drone Photography Contest.
Now in its second year, the contest attracted pictures of people performing high dives, swimming while being surrounded by sharks, unprecedented views of iconic cityscapes, islands and architecture.
Set up by Dronestagram with the help of National Geographic, more than 5,000 pictures were submitted across three categories: Places, Nature and Dronies (selfies taken with a drone).
Dronestagram is an online hub for photographers to view, like and comment on photos and videos captured by drones.
The overall winner that took out the Places category and was voted most popular, was a shot entitled ‘Above the Mist’ showing the tip of a cathedral, poking through the mist below.
First Prize winner in Places category, and most popular ... Above the Mist, by Ricardo Matiello, of Maringa Cathedral, Parana, Brazil. Picture: Ricardo Matiello / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
The photographer who won second prize in the Places category took this shot of the famous Mont-Saint Michel island commune in Normandy, France.
Second Prize winner in the Places category ... Mont-Saint-Michel, France. Picture: Wanaiifilms / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
The image that claimed third prize in the Places category was of some colourful fields.
Third Prize winner in the Places category ... Tuild Fields. Picture: Andersa / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
First prize in the Nature category went to a photographer who captured two people snorkelling with sharks surrounding them in Tahiti.
First prize in Nature category ... Snorkelling with Sharks. Picture: Tahitiflyshoot / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
Second prize in the Nature category went to a photo of swimmers making their way into the ocean as waves hit the shore.
Second Prize in the Nature category ... La Jolla. Picture: Kdilliard / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
Third prize in the same category was won by the owner of this image taken by a drone hovering over Lost Island in Tahaa, French Polynesia.
Third prize in the Nature category ... Lost Island, Tahaa, French Polynesia. Picture: Marama Photo Video / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
The first prize winner in the Dronies category went to this image of people dressed as the children’s book character Wally from the Where’s Wally? book series.
First Prize Winner in the Dronies category ... Where’s Wally, Limassol Carnaval. Picture: FlyovermediaCY / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
In the Popular/Most Liked category, second prize went to this aerial view of city lights at night in Bulgaria.
Second Prize winner in the Most Popular category ... Plovdiv by Night, Bulgaria. Picture: Ice Fire / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
Third prize in this category went to this picture of a man doing a high dive in Mexico.
Third Prize Winner in the Popular/Most Liked category ... Glorieto Rodolfo Sanchez Taboada, Mazatian, Sinaloa, Mexico. Picture: Wootsor / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
Notable mentions included these images taken by drones being used by photographers located in Hawaii, Ghana, Japan and China.
Notable mention ... Mt. Fuji, Japan. Picture: Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
Notable mention ... Xiwei Reservoir, Zoucheng, Shandong, China. Picture: Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
Notable mention ... Abrui, Ghana. Picture: Aeroshutter / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
A photographer whose drone captured a view of the top of the famous statue of Christ the Redeemer in Brazil was also given a notable mention.
Notable mention ... Christ the Redeemer, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Picture: Abusalem / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
This photo of a large whale shark swimming alongside tourists was also given a notable mention, as was an image showing a warped bird’s eye view of the Petronas Twin Towers in Kuala Lumpur.
Notable mention ... Whale shark and tourists in an unknown location. Picture: Postandfly / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
Notable mention ... Petronas Twin Towers, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Picture: Efearn / Dronestagram / Caters News Source: Supplied
The contest was judged on creativity, photographic quality and respect of the theme.
Eric Dupin, founder and CEO of Dronestagram, said: “I was really amazed by the quality and the originality of most of the pictures we received from the participants of the 2015 edition of our great contest.
“Last year we had to make a choice among 2000 pictures, but this year we had to review more than 5000 pictures in three categories.
“Drone photography depicts a new vision of the world, with stunning images taken from low altitude, near field.
“It is a new photographic language and a new way of discovering things and landscapes that we know, or that we thought we knew.”
